[trafilatura] Ola Electric's Funding Rounds
Ola Electric has raised a total of $1B over 14 funding rounds: 1 Seed, 4 Early-Stage, 5 Late-Stage and 4 Debt rounds. Ola Electric's largest funding round so far was a Series B round for $267M in Jul 2019, led by SoftBank.
Here is the list of all funding rounds of Ola Electric:
Date of funding | Funding Amount | Round Name | Post money valuation | Revenue multiple | Investors |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
Jun 12, 2024 | $12M | Conventional Debt | - | - | |
Apr 01, 2024 | $49.2M | Conventional Debt | - | - | |
Dec 06, 2023 | $2.4M | Angel | $5.75B | - | |
Oct 26, 2023 | $240M | Conventional Debt | - | - | |
Jul 14, 2023 | $140M | Series E | $5.76B | 11.9x | |
Apr 01, 2022 | $7.49M | Series D | $5.28B | - | |
Feb 25, 2022 | $123M | Series D | $5.34B | - | |
Jan 22, 2022 | $200M | Series C | - | - | Edelweiss, Tekne Private Ventures, Alpine Opportunity Fund, Barry S Sternlicht, Tekne Capital Management, DIG Investment, Ab Initio Capital, Ashna Advisors, Jasneet Singh, NK Aggarwal, Bipin Gupta, Rakesh Aggarwal, Brijesh Gupta, Dinesh Aggarwal, Mahimn Sodhani, Nipun Goel, Alpha Wave Global, Alpine Investors, NK Aggarwal, Bipin Gupta, Rakesh Aggarwal, Brijesh Gupta, Dinesh Aggarwal, Nipun Goel |
Oct 04, 2021 | $200M | Series C | $2.87B | 60.5x | Alpha Wave Investors, SoftBank, MacRitchie Investments, Edelweiss, 360 One, Rahul Ravindra Raj Mehta, Ashna Advisors, Sumit Shah, Azara, Farhan Akhtar, Rohan Ramchandani, Ritesh Sidhwani, Zoya Akhtar, Alpha Wave Global, Temasek, DIG Investment, Barry S Sternlicht, VSS Investco, Sumit Shah, Ritesh Sidhwani, Rohan Ramchandani |
Jul 12, 2021 | $100M | Conventional Debt | - | - | |
Mar 12, 2020 | $1.35M | Series B | $982M | - | |
Jul 02, 2019 | $267M | Series B | $356M | - | |
May 06, 2019 | $2.13M | Series A | $286M | 75.9x | |
Feb 26, 2019 | $57M | Series A | $277M | - |
Note: Investors shown in bold are lead investors in that round
Get Ola Electric's Funding & Investors list, delivered to your inbox!
Ola Electric's Investors
Here is the list of institutional investors of Ola Electric:
- Alteria Capital, located in Mumbai (India), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Jun 12, 2024 in its Conventional Debt round.
- EvolutionX, located in Singapore (Singapore), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Apr 01, 2024 in its Conventional Debt round.
- SBI, located in Mumbai (India), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Oct 26, 2023 in its Conventional Debt round.
- Temasek, located in Singapore (Singapore), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Oct 04, 2021 in its Series C round.
- Tiger Global Management, located in New York City (United States), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Feb 26, 2019 in its Series A round.
- DIG Investment, located in Stockholm (Sweden), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Oct 04, 2021 in its Series C round.
- Blue Investment, located in New York City (United States), made their first investment in Ola Electr

[trafilatura] - Ola Electrics IPO, which opens today, pegs the electric two-wheeler leaders valuation at US$4 billion25% less than what it was less than a year ago
- Overpromises and under-delivery of rosy past projections in previous private fund-raises have come home to roost for the company
- In a booming stock market, theres the rich irony of a downround IPO. Calling it an attractive price for new investors is making a virtue out of necessity
- Ola Electric, in need of a quick cash boost, is settling for a valuation cut. Even then, the offering falls short for investors
Enter your email address to receive a daily summary of all our stories.
Ola Electric Mobilitys maiden public issue of Rs 6,000 crore+ (>US$717 million)which opens for retail investors today and is expected to be Indias largest in 2024is a bundle of contradictions.
The countrys stock market is seeing an unprecedented bull run, with its bellwether indices BSE Sensex and Nifty 50 breaching new highs every other day. Yet, the electric-vehicle (EV) companys asking price for its initial public offer (IPO) pegs its valuationRs 33,500 croreat a steep 25% discount to what it
Why would Indias leading electric two-wheeler maker, which sells more than one out of every three of these vehicles in the country and is gung-ho about its prospects, settle for so less? In fact, in December 2023, the company was
What changed so much, so soon?
Bhavish Aggarwal, Ola Electrics chief executive, would have you believe that the company wants to leave money on the table for new investors in the public issuebanking on a typical listing-day pop.
I wanted to make sure we price it attractively for the entire investor community in India, Aggarwal said in a media interaction late in July. He has also brushed aside earlier reports of the expected high valuation. I think the numbers that were reported were speculation; we never put out a number. Sometimes these speculations build on themselves. But then we had a choice and we chose to actually keep the IPO very attractively priced, he said in another interaction.
If only.
The valuation slash is not the only thing that strikes as odd. Three institutional investorsAb Initio Capital, Alpine Opportunity Fund, and Tekne Private Ventureswill be selling some of their shares in Ola Electric at a tidy loss, show the IPO documents.

memory.original_query: Query 1: What is the latest stock price of Ola Electric?
memory.summarizer_summary:
Ola Electric is not a publicly traded company, so a real-time stock price is not available. However, the latest valuation information comes from its IPO, which opened on August 9, 2024.

*   **IPO Valuation:** The IPO valued Ola Electric at approximately **US$4 billion**, which is a 25% discount compared to its valuation less than a year prior.
*   **Funding Rounds:** Ola Electric has raised a total of $1.569B over 15 rounds. A Series E funding round in September 2023 valued the company between $5.4 billion and $5.5 billion.
*   **Recent Debt Funding:**
    *   June 11, 2024: $11.97M (Debt - IV)
    *   April 1, 2024: $50M (Debt - III)

Sources:

*   [Tracxn](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/ola-electric/__6IJkJRdLTLqpbr0U9y9iAZUrtZVZC1HCfmjdnQe6edo/funding-and-investors)
*   [CB Insights](https://www.cbinsights.com/company/ola-electric-mobility/financials)
*   [The Ken](https://the-ken.com/story/the-real-reason-behind-ola-electric-slashing-its-ipo-valuation-in-a-booming-stock-market/)

text_list_1A.text:
[trafilatura] Ola Electric's Funding Rounds
Ola Electric has raised a total of $1B over 14 funding rounds: 1 Seed, 4 Early-Stage, 5 Late-Stage and 4 Debt rounds. Ola Electric's largest funding round so far was a Series B round for $267M in Jul 2019, led by SoftBank.
Here is the list of all funding rounds of Ola Electric:
Date of funding | Funding Amount | Round Name | Post money valuation | Revenue multiple | Investors |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
Jun 12, 2024 | $12M | Conventional Debt | - | - | |
Apr 01, 2024 | $49.2M | Conventional Debt | - | - | |
Dec 06, 2023 | $2.4M | Angel | $5.75B | - | |
Oct 26, 2023 | $240M | Conventional Debt | - | - | |
Jul 14, 2023 | $140M | Series E | $5.76B | 11.9x | |
Apr 01, 2022 | $7.49M | Series D | $5.28B | - | |
Feb 25, 2022 | $123M | Series D | $5.34B | - | |
Jan 22, 2022 | $200M | Series C | - | - | Edelweiss, Tekne Private Ventures, Alpine Opportunity Fund, Barry S Sternlicht, Tekne Capital Management, DIG Investment, Ab Initio Capital, Ashna Advisors, Jasneet Singh, NK Aggarwal, Bipin Gupta, Rakesh Aggarwal, Brijesh Gupta, Dinesh Aggarwal, Mahimn Sodhani, Nipun Goel, Alpha Wave Global, Alpine Investors, NK Aggarwal, Bipin Gupta, Rakesh Aggarwal, Brijesh Gupta, Dinesh Aggarwal, Nipun Goel |
Oct 04, 2021 | $200M | Series C | $2.87B | 60.5x | Alpha Wave Investors, SoftBank, MacRitchie Investments, Edelweiss, 360 One, Rahul Ravindra Raj Mehta, Ashna Advisors, Sumit Shah, Azara, Farhan Akhtar, Rohan Ramchandani, Ritesh Sidhwani, Zoya Akhtar, Alpha Wave Global, Temasek, DIG Investment, Barry S Sternlicht, VSS Investco, Sumit Shah, Ritesh Sidhwani, Rohan Ramchandani |
Jul 12, 2021 | $100M | Conventional Debt | - | - | |
Mar 12, 2020 | $1.35M | Series B | $982M | - | |
Jul 02, 2019 | $267M | Series B | $356M | - | |
May 06, 2019 | $2.13M | Series A | $286M | 75.9x | |
Feb 26, 2019 | $57M | Series A | $277M | - |
Note: Investors shown in bold are lead investors in that round
Get Ola Electric's Funding & Investors list, delivered to your inbox!
Ola Electric's Investors
Here is the list of institutional investors of Ola Electric:
- Alteria Capital, located in Mumbai (India), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Jun 12, 2024 in its Conventional Debt round.
- EvolutionX, located in Singapore (Singapore), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Apr 01, 2024 in its Conventional Debt round.
- SBI, located in Mumbai (India), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Oct 26, 2023 in its Conventional Debt round.
- Temasek, located in Singapore (Singapore), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Oct 04, 2021 in its Series C round.
- Tiger Global Management, located in New York City (United States), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Feb 26, 2019 in its Series A round.
- DIG Investment, located in Stockholm (Sweden), made their first investment in Ola Electric on Oct 04, 2021 in its Series C round.
- Blue Investment, located in New York City (United States), made their first investment in Ola Electr
[timeout] [no text]

[trafilatura] - Ola Electrics IPO, which opens today, pegs the electric two-wheeler leaders valuation at US$4 billion25% less than what it was less than a year ago
- Overpromises and under-delivery of rosy past projections in previous private fund-raises have come home to roost for the company
- In a booming stock market, theres the rich irony of a downround IPO. Calling it an attractive price for new investors is making a virtue out of necessity
- Ola Electric, in need of a quick cash boost, is settling for a valuation cut. Even then, the offering falls short for investors
Enter your email address to receive a daily summary of all our stories.
Ola Electric Mobilitys maiden public issue of Rs 6,000 crore+ (>US$717 million)which opens for retail investors today and is expected to be Indias largest in 2024is a bundle of contradictions.
The countrys stock market is seeing an unprecedented bull run, with its bellwether indices BSE Sensex and Nifty 50 breaching new highs every other day. Yet, the electric-vehicle (EV) companys asking price for its initial public offer (IPO) pegs its valuationRs 33,500 croreat a steep 25% discount to what it
Why would Indias leading electric two-wheeler maker, which sells more than one out of every three of these vehicles in the country and is gung-ho about its prospects, settle for so less? In fact, in December 2023, the company was
What changed so much, so soon?
Bhavish Aggarwal, Ola Electrics chief executive, would have you believe that the company wants to leave money on the table for new investors in the public issuebanking on a typical listing-day pop.
I wanted to make sure we price it attractively for the entire investor community in India, Aggarwal said in a media interaction late in July. He has also brushed aside earlier reports of the expected high valuation. I think the numbers that were reported were speculation; we never put out a number. Sometimes these speculations build on themselves. But then we had a choice and we chose to actually keep the IPO very attractively priced, he said in another interaction.
If only.
The valuation slash is not the only thing that strikes as odd. Three institutional investorsAb Initio Capital, Alpine Opportunity Fund, and Tekne Private Ventureswill be selling some of their shares in Ola Electric at a tidy loss, show the IPO documents.
Share this article with your network
Send the article link to friends or colleagues who might find this story interesting or insightful.
Send the article link to friends or colleagues who might find this story interesting or insightful.

[trafilatura] - Ola Electrics IPO, which opens today, pegs the electric two-wheeler leaders valuation at US$4 billion25% less than what it was less than a year ago
- Overpromises and under-delivery of rosy past projections in previous private fund-raises have come home to roost for the company
- In a booming stock market, theres the rich irony of a downround IPO. Calling it an attractive price for new investors is making a virtue out of necessity
- Ola Electric, in need of a quick cash boost, is settling for a valuation cut. Even then, the offering falls short for investors
Enter your email address to receive a daily summary of all our stories.
Ola Electric Mobilitys maiden public issue of Rs 6,000 crore+ (>US$717 million)which opens for retail investors today and is expected to be Indias largest in 2024is a bundle of contradictions.
The countrys stock market is seeing an unprecedented bull run, with its bellwether indices BSE Sensex and Nifty 50 breaching new highs every other day. Yet, the electric-vehicle (EV) companys asking price for its initial public offer (IPO) pegs its valuationRs 33,500 croreat a steep 25% discount to what it
Why would Indias leading electric two-wheeler maker, which sells more than one out of every three of these vehicles in the country and is gung-ho about its prospects, settle for so less? In fact, in December 2023, the company was
What changed so much, so soon?
Bhavish Aggarwal, Ola Electrics chief executive, would have you believe that the company wants to leave money on the table for new investors in the public issuebanking on a typical listing-day pop.
I wanted to make sure we price it attractively for the entire investor community in India, Aggarwal said in a media interaction late in July. He has also brushed aside earlier reports of the expected high valuation. I think the numbers that were reported were speculation; we never put out a number. Sometimes these speculations build on themselves. But then we had a choice and we chose to actually keep the IPO very attractively priced, he said in another interaction.
If only.
The valuation slash is not the only thing that strikes as odd. Three institutional investorsAb Initio Capital, Alpine Opportunity Fund, and Tekne Private Ventureswill be selling some of their shares in Ola Electric at a tidy loss, show the IPO documents.

summarizer_snapshots.summary_output:
Ola Electric is not a publicly traded company, so a real-time stock price is not available. However, the latest valuation information comes from its IPO, which opened on August 9, 2024.

*   **IPO Valuation:** The IPO valued Ola Electric at approximately **US$4 billion**, which is a 25% discount compared to its valuation less than a year prior.
*   **Funding Rounds:** Ola Electric has raised a total of $1.569B over 15 rounds. A Series E funding round in September 2023 valued the company between $5.4 billion and $5.5 billion.
*   **Recent Debt Funding:**
    *   June 11, 2024: $11.97M (Debt - IV)
    *   April 1, 2024: $50M (Debt - III)

Sources:

*   [Tracxn](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/ola-electric/__6IJkJRdLTLqpbr0U9y9iAZUrtZVZC1HCfmjdnQe6edo/funding-and-investors)
*   [CB Insights](https://www.cbinsights.com/company/ola-electric-mobility/financials)
*   [The Ken](https://the-ken.com/story/the-real-reason-behind-ola-electric-slashing-its-ipo-valuation-in-a-booming-stock-market/)
